task.title: Bring back both appliances after both appliances fail simultaneously by using the GUI
task.shortdesc: In this scenario, a massive power loss causes both the primary node and the standby node to fail. You must restart both nodes.

context.p: You can configure appliances for high availability by using the , or by using the command line. For more information about using the command line to configure appliances for high availability, see . In this scenario, the content of the store and configuration of Appliance A is preserved.

info.p: If the server on one or both of the appliances does not start, check the logs for messages. For more information about the log files, see .

step.cmd: Verify that the server is running in production mode on both appliances.
step.info: You can view the status of each appliance from the Status menu on the . You can view further information on the status of the appliance by using the System Control page.

step.cmd: If either appliance is not running in production mode, check the logs for messages and resolve the problem.
step.info: Depending on the nature of the problem, you might need to perform further action as described in .

taskbody.result: You can view further information about the high availability role of the appliance by using the High Availability page.
